    • Constructor Detail

      • AppbaseClient

        public AppbaseClient(java.lang.String URL,
                     java.lang.String app,
                     java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String password)
        new Appbase() create a new Appbase() by passing in arguments:
        Parameters:
        URL - The base URL eg. "www.example.com" or "http://scalr.api.appbase.io".
        appName - application name eg. "myFirstApp" or "jsfiddle-demo"
        userName - the user name provided for the app eg. "7eJWHfD4P"
        password - the password corresponding to the userName eg. "431d9cea-5219-4dfb-b798-f897f3a02665"

        public java.lang.String index(java.lang.String type,
                              java.lang.String id,
                              java.lang.String jsonDoc)
        To index a object easily by just inputing the parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the object
        id - the id at which it need to be inserted
        jsonDoc - the String which is the JSON for the object to be inserted
        Returns:
        the result after the operation. It contains the details of the operations execution.

        public AppbaseRequestBuilder prepareIndex(java.lang.String type,

        To prepare the index. To have control on when it is executed or to add parameters or queries
        Parameters:

        id - the id at which it need to be inserted

      • update

        public java.lang.String update(java.lang.String type,
                               java.lang.String id,
                               java.util.List<org.asynchttpclient.Param> parameters,
                               java.lang.String jsonDoc)
        To update a document. We can pass just the portion of the object to be updated. parameters is a list of parameters which are the name value pairs which will be added during the execution
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the object
        id - the id at which it need to be inserted
        parameters - A list of all the parameters for a specific update
        jsonDoc - the String which is the JSON for the object to be inserted
        Returns:
        the result after the operation. It contains the details of the operations execution.

      • getStream

        public void getStream(java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String id,
                      AppbaseStreamHandler asyncHandler)
        Get the stream for a indexed object. If any changes happen, the user can state what to happen by overriding the onData method or overriding the onBodyPartRecieved.
        Parameters:
        type - type of the object
        id - id of the object
        asyncHandler - a async handler object. It is preferable to pass a Appbase Handler object as single body may come as multiple body parts which need to be managed which is implemented by Appbase Handler.

      • prepareGetStream

        public AppbaseRequestBuilder prepareGetStream(java.lang.String type,
                                              java.lang.String id)

      • getPipedStream

        public java.io.PipedInputStream getPipedStream(java.lang.String type,
                                               java.lang.String id)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • searchStream

        public void searchStream(java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String body,
                         AppbaseStreamHandler asyncHandler)
        Get the search stream for a indexed object. If any changes happen and the changes contain some part of the query, the user can state what to happen by overriding the onData() method or the onBodyPartRecieved() method.
        Parameters:
        type - type of the object
        id - id of the object
        appbaseHandlerSaveStream - a async handler object. It is preferable to pass a Appbase Handler object as single body may come as multiple body parts which need to be managed which is implemented by Appbase Handler.

      • searchStream

        public void searchStream(java.lang.String type,
                         org.elasticsearch.index.query.QueryBuilder body,
                         AppbaseStreamHandler asyncHandler)
